original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady at open, rupee at 291.50/292.25 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bonds opened steady on Monday, dealers said while the Spot US dollar opened at 291.50/292.25 rupees, dealers said.
The Spot US dollar closed at 291.75/292.50 rupees on Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 24.60/25.00 percent up from 24.70/90 percent a day earlier, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 25.75/26.30 percent up from 25.75/26.25 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 26.30/27.30 percent, up from 27.00/30 per cent at last close.
